text: <@U12AHQ3NK> , it should work without a problem in 06. Adding <@U0S5KF44D>, <@U0ZR63HLK>, <@U221LL03Z> , as they have worked on this.

<@U22H7GFGA>, can you give more information on what is the requirement coming from the application? that is, what is this session variable, and where it needs to store it? Adding <@U0S5KF44D>, <@U13TWBRBL>  as they are more informed to answer this question :slightly_smiling_face:

<@U22H7GFGA> you don’t want to save the raw Member object, instead use the saveState() and restoreState() methods provided by the class to serialize and deserialize. now those methods uses the KeyValStore as persistence, but you can implement your own KeyValStore implementation (very simple, just two methods) based on the session object storage, and set that to the chain object.
Is it possible to use non-private mode in HFC v0.6(.5)?  I.e. use ECerts for transactions instead of one TCert per transaction
As far as I can tell, looking through the code, it isn't, but just wanted to make sure I'm not missing something.

<@U2X9KDDL7> that’s correct, HFC v0.6 handles tcerts under the cover so you don’t get to override that to use ecerts unfortunately. i don’t believe ecerts are going to be properly processed by the peers even if you manage to send it in the transaction
